definition[0]: if someone is reinstated, they are officially given back their job after it was taken away
definition[1]: to make something such as a law, system, or rule exist again
example[0]: California reinstated the death penalty in 1977.
definition[2]: to put someone back into a job or position of authority from which they had previously been removed
example[1]: His claim of unfair dismissal was upheld and he was later reinstated.
example[2]: She was cleared by the investigation and immediately reinstated as Finance Director.
definition[3]: to put back into a document, agreement etc something that had previously been taken out
example[3]: We agreed to reinstate this clause in the contract.
definition[4]: to bring back into effect an insurance POLICY that has not been in effect for some time, for example because the regular payments for it have not been made
